job_title: Accounts Recieveable Specialist in Oglesby, IL
pros: Good work life balance. Great working environment. Good PTO

job_title: IT Service Desk in Oglesby, IL
pros: Relatively slow paced, relaxed work environment.

job_title: Academic Support Technologist in Oglesby, IL
pros:
- You get to work with some great people and amazing students. You'll get to meet a lot of people in the area and get to possibly be involved in some good opportunities.
- The schedule is usually flexible.
- There are guest speakers and you will be allowed to sit in on lectures as long as it's approved.
- SURS. Getting out of paying social security is great. If you plan on staying in the Illinois Valley for your whole life, this is a great benefit for retirement.
- Tuition reimbursements for classes at the college.
cons:
- Management and upper management aren't that good. This is a very chain-of-command  place, and if you go above your direct superior because you think things aren't being taken care of, you will get written up.
- Schedule can change without notification.
- Not much room for improvement. If you want to improve things, it has to go through management, which is extremely slow.
- General frustration by staff and faculty. There used to be a great president, but the current one is not liked by the employees.
- Lots of down time. They're rigid on what you are able to do as well.
- Very focused on following policy.

pros: Limited oversight, teach your course go home. Very free to make changes with in the curriculum to better the students
cons: Not willing to consider change to save money or to consolidate courses that have 90% overlap. They feel that taking jobs that overlap away from full time staff is not fair. However the cost savings would be astronomical and would include a better all around program.
